DOC.brief_title: S9333A Study Blood Bone Marrow Samples From Patients With Previously Untreated Primary Acute Myeloid Leukemia
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - Determine whether calmodulin-dependent protein kinase II-γ ( CaMKIIγ ) activation ( autophosphorylation ) associate specific clinicopathological variable outcomes blood bone marrow sample patient previously untreated primary acute myeloid leukemia . OUTLINE : Blood bone marrow sample analyze western blot use SDS-PAGE immunoblotting use anti-calmodulin-dependent protein kinase II-γ ( CaMKIIγ ) anti-phosphospecific ( Thr286 , 287 ) CaMKIIγ antibodies signal detect via chemiluminescence . CaMKIIγ activation level link clinical variable within SWOG database .
